_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP Executive Summary



1.0  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at Tampa Maid Foods.



Tampa Maid Foods prevents accidental releases through classroom and on the job training of refrigeration personnel and ongoing inspection and maintenance of the refrigeration system.  Wherever possible refrigeration system components are located in areas that are not as likely to become damaged (i.e., tanks and pipe runs are placed away and protected from forklift and truck traffic). The facility maintains an ongoing emergency response program that prepares for safe evacuation and timely response by trained personnel.



2.0  Tampa Maid Foods and Anhydrous Ammonia.



Tampa Maid Foods processes and freezes seafood products for global distribution. Approximately 26,843 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia is contained within the refrigeration system on site at Tampa Maid Foods. A Risk Management Plan has been developed as required and is maintained in order to reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia from the system. 



3.0  Accidental Release Prevention Program and Prevention Steps.



Tampa Maid Foods complies with all rules and regulations that pertain to the safe storage and use of anhydrous ammonia. Specific regulations include: OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) rule; OSHA Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER); OSHA Hazard Communication (HAZCOM); OSHA Employee Emergency Plans and Fire Prevention Plans; EPA Risk Management Plans (RMP). 



Specific prevention steps that have been implemented to increase the safety of operation of the ammonia refrigeration system include: The refrigeration department has implemented an ePSM software management program to better organize and manage all refrigeration related PSM documentation as well as maintenance planning and record keeping. 



4.0  Five Year Accident History.



3/23/2014 Leak in coil of Gyro #3,and 8/9/2013 Leak in coil of Gyro # 2; Minor release(Less than 1 lb),f

rom old aluminum coil under vacuum. No employee injuries. Coils replaced with new stainless steel coils. 





5.0  Tampa Maid Foods Emergency Response Program.



Tampa Maid Foods maintains an ongoing emergency response program in order to efficiently notify and evacuate employees, notify potential critical receptors in the community and state and local emergency response agencies. The program includes initial and annual training for employees who respond to releases or potential releases. The program includes written procedures for proper first aid and emergency medical treatment to treat human exposures; procedures for using emergency response equipment and procedures to review and update the plan and ensure that employees are informed of changes. The facility emergency response plan is coordinated with the local fire department annually as required by the Emergency Planning and Community Right to Know Act.



6.0  Planned Changes to Improve Safety at Tampa Maid Foods.



Future plans to improve anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system safety at Tampa Maid Foods include: 1. Complete ePSM training for all refrigeration department personnel. 2.Complete contractor safety program evaluations for all refrigeration contractors.
